Line 147: Line 147:
===Censorship in Germany and France===
===Censorship in Germany and France===
â
On October 22, 2002, Jonathan Zittrain and Benjamin Edelman from the Berkman Center for Internet & Society at the Harvard Law School published a study reporting the internet sites that had been quietly censored by the German and French sections of Google. [http://cyber.law.harvard.edu/filtering/google] The censorship mainly affects [[White Nationalism|White Nationalistic]], [[National Socialism|National Socialistic]], [[anti-semetic]], and radical Islamic websites.
+
On October 22, 2002, Jonathan Zittrain and Benjamin Edelman from the Berkman Center for Internet & Society at the Harvard Law School published a study reporting the internet sites that had been quietly censored by the German and French sections of Google. [http://cyber.law.harvard.edu/filtering/google] The censorship mainly affects [[White Nationalism|White Nationalistic]], [[Nazism|Nazi]], [[anti-semetic]], and radical Islamic websites.
===Censorship in mainland China===
===Censorship in mainland China===
